intro: Goniolimon tataricum, commonly known as Tatarian stonevetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features small, pea-like flowers that are usually pale blue or violet in color. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds. Goniolimon tataricum is adapted to harsh environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
